key_points: Tiger Woods hospitalized with severe leg injuries after a car accident in Los Angeles.
Injuries not life-threatening; Woods was conscious and able to communicate post-accident.
No evidence of driver impairment; Woods assessed by emergency workers at the scene.
Woods underwent a "long surgical procedure" on his lower right leg and ankle.
Injuries included open fractures to his tibia and fibula, stabilized with a rod, screws, and pins.
Accident's impact on Woods' career remains unclear.
Sheriff mentioned the crash site is known for frequent accidents, suggesting speed might have been a factor.
Woods celebrated for transforming golf, broadening its appeal, and his major accomplishments.
The PGA Tour and sports figures like Alex Rodriguez express support and concern for Woods.
This is not Woods' first encounter with an auto-related incident.
spokespersons: Daryl Osby (Los Angeles County Fire Chief)
Anish Mahajan (Chief Medical Officer and interim CEO, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
